channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: School Safety - Road unpassable for Coaches and Articulated Lorries, 11th September
item.description:
Marylebone High Street is currently closed Southbound due to utility works. This is close to a secondary school. Traffic from Marylebone Road is entering Marylebone High Street but long vehicles are unable to navigate the diversion along Beaumont Street due to the sharp bend. The only option available to them is to reverse back out of Devonshire Street and reverse North along Marylebone High Street past our School until they are near to Marylebone Raod where they can turn around. I am witnessing this several times every day and it is a safety concern. At the very least a sign needs to be erected on Marylebone Road to prohibit long vehicles turning into Marylebone High Street whilst these works continue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 68, Marylebone High Street, Marylebone, Camden Town, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead tree branch overhanging pavement, 11th September
item.description:
The tree outside Nos 68 and 72 Copers Cope Road is overhanging the pavement, a dead branch, and is a danger to pedestrians. The tree has a lot of dead branches and is a victim of "tree retrenchment" and needs assessing by the Council and appropriate pruning carried out.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Copers Cope Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lesney Park Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Still dog poo everywhere, 11th September
item.description:
The previous response makes no sense: "Our contractor has attended the reported site but was unable to locate the reported issue, and we are therefore unable to action this report further; it may be that the issue has already been addressed by our proactive teams" How did they not see the state of the street? These two streets in particular are always filthy and taking kids to school is a minefield of poo. Why can't they be cleaned regularly without waiting for them to get in this state? This wouldn't happen in Beckenhan so why is it considered ok for us?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ravenscroft Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet
